sen.j: 自らが、阿弥陀如来の本願を信じた上で、念仏し生きたこと。
sen.e: The person should believe in Original Vow (the vow of Amitabha Tathagata, or Amida Buddha, to save all people who chant "nenbutsu" [Buddhist invocation, in which the name of the Amida Buddha is chanted]) and chant nenbutsu himself.
sen.cmt: ・「本願」の訳につき、下記HPを参照しています。[http://ci.nii.ac.jp/naid/110000312055]・その中身につき括弧書きで「阿弥陀仏の、念仏の衆生を救いとげん（念仏を唱える全ての人間を救済しよう）、との誓願」と解説しています。
sen.e: The person should believe in the Original Vow (the vow of Amitabha Tathagata, or Amida Buddha, to save all people who chant "nenbutsu" [a Buddhist invocation in which the name of the Amida Buddha is chanted]), and should himself chant nenbutsu.
The person should live and chant nenbutsu (Buddhist invocation) by oneself while believing in the Original Vow of Amida Buddha (Amitabha Tathagata).

sen.j: 自力による行・念仏によって浄土往生しようとした者は、選定されていない。
sen.e: The list excluded those who tried to go to Buddhist paradise by implementing religious austerities and nenbutsu chanting that put an emphasis on self-salvation.
The list excluded those who tried to reach the Buddhist paradise by implementing religious austerities and nenbutsu chanting that put an emphasis on self-salvation.
